description:
Collaborative work by Maroun Mahfoud & Anthony Saab

Total integration time : 44 hrs
SII: 45 x 600s
OIII:220 x 300s
Ha: 220 x 300s

LION THE KING
Lion Nebula/Sharpless 132 is a faint emission type nebula at the Cepheus/Lacerta border. Has a size of about 30 x 20 arcminutes corresponding to a physical diameter of 16 light years.
It is estimated to be about 1794 light years from our solar system and 10,000 to 12,000 light-years away from our little blue planet.
The stars responsible for the ionization of radiant hydrogen and oxygen gas clouds are two Wolf-Rayet stars, HD 211564 (WR 152) and HD 211853 (WR 153).(Massive stars which are at an advanced stage of stellar evolution and losing mass at a very high rate)
Other objects that are around this area in the image including NGC7226, Berkeley 94 and LDN 1156 & 1161.
title: Lion Nebula / Sh 2-132
